page.title: 06HOUSING IN MARTON/NUNTHORPE
page.content: There doesn't seem to be much else in Nunthorpe and Marton apart from housing. Most of the houses have been built within the last 50 years, with the older housing lining the main roads of the area such as Stokesley Rd., Gypsy Lane and Guisborough Rd. Newer housing estates fill in the spaces between the main roads. A housing survey carried out by the children of Captain Cook School revealed that 61% of the houses in Marton were built in the l970's, 22% in the l960's and only 8% in the 1950's, thus showing the recent origin of most of the housing in the area. The majority of dwellings in the area are houses or bungalows. In Marton the survey revealed 95% houses, 4% bungalows and only 1% flats.
